utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So what brings you here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I've had this cough, ongoing now for the last three days and I found I've had a more difficult time breathing as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and So what came first? did the cough come first?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, the cough started first.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and so it started three days ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: When did the shortness of breath start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That started probably about two days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the cough, can you describe it a little bit? Is it like a wet cough, a dry cough? How would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I brought up a little bit of sputum. It's been clear, mostly clear and sometimes dry as well. The cough's been getting worse over the last couple of days as well and hasn't really stopped either, it's just kind of ongoing all day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it's it's pretty constant?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's been constant.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how much sputum would you say you're bringing up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say, uh, maybe like two teaspoons a day. It's only like a little bit in the tissues and I'm not bringing up sputum every time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is your sputum at all yellow, green? Or does it have any blood tinge content in it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it's mainly just white or clear.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's mostly, yeah, like whiteish or clear.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, and have you had anything like this happen before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how would you describe the shortness of breath? Are you having trouble taking deep breaths or are you having trouble breathing when exerting yourself, like how would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have like, a chest tightness. I find when I exert myself it gets worse and after I cough, I have a little bit of trouble catching my breath as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, When do you have the chest tightness, when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, that's started within the last two days as well, with the cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so is it just the tightness when you cough or is it there just throughout?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah if I take like a deep breath in, like, it just feels tight, like I can't get a deep breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any kind of, like swelling in your calves, or pain in your calves at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any surgeries recently or have you been immobilized for a long time or admitted to a hospital or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had anything like that, I've been healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had anything like a blood clot, either in your legs or traveling up to your lungs in the past before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you been diagnosed with cancer or any other medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK uhm, so would you say the coughing and the shortness of breath is getting worse, or it's about the same?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'd say it's gotten a little bit worse over these last couple of days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is there anything that makes your symptoms better or worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, if I exert myself it does make it a bit worse. It'll bring on the cough more, and shortness of breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about any positional changes? Like, does lying down help? Does resting help relieve some of that tightness, cough and shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that has helped.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you tried any kind of medications at all, over the counter?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't tried anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, so it seems that your shortness of breath, is it, uh, mainly when you're breathing in or breathing out? Or are you having shallow breaths? How would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say it, yeah, I kind of go back to the chest tightness, it just feels like I'm not able to, like, breath in all the way and catch my breath after I exert myself or coughing. It's easy Uh, like if I rest I'm not short of breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you have any other symptoms? like a runny nose, sore throat? Anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have had a little bit of a headache over the last day. Usually I get headaches like this when I haven't slept well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it like a different type of headache and is it on one side of your head or both?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I feel it on both, kinda like right up into my forehead there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it kind of like a pressure like pain? Is it pulsating pain? How would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say it's more of a pressure, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, have you tried any medications for it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, Yeah, I took an Advil this morning. It's taken the edge off a little bit. I will use that sometimes when I get headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Are you having any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you traveled outside of the country or outside of the province at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you been in contact with anyone that's been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so. I work at the Toyota factory and there have been a few people that have been sick who worked there? But I don't think I've been in contact with them.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you having any fevers or chills at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have felt pretty hot, yeah, I was sweaty last night, I didn't check a temperature, but I felt feverish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, were you having night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My bed wasn't drenched or anything but I was sweating.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK are you feeling like you have lost any sense of taste or smell at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, Yeah, I haven't been able to smell very well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That may be within the last two days as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you congested at all? Like, do you have a runny nose or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't have anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, any changes in your bowel movements, like any Constipation or diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have felt a bit sore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Where would you say you feel sore?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just kind of all over, my whole body just kind of feels a bit achy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did this start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, probably like last night, this morning when I was laying down and just felt a bit tired and achy?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Has your sleep or appetite changed at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I didn't sleep very good last night. I just don't feel very rested this morning. And yeah, I haven't felt very hungry either.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, alright, do you have any medical conditions that you take any medications for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't take any medications.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any surgeries or have been hospitalized before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did have tubes in my ears when I was little, but that's it though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any family history of any heart or lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, my dad had a triple bypass surgery done last last year. He was sixty-three at the time and that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you don't have any high blood pressure or anything like that, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, just environmental stuff I think, just, like in the springtime, I'll get itchy eyes or a runny nose.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and currently do you work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do, yeah I work at a car factory nearby, just on the assembly line.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you been off of work right now, with your symptoms? How is that going?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, just like these last two days I called in and I let them know and I left work early yesterday when I realized that I was feeling sick and didn't go in this morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh, and what's your living situation like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So I live with my girlfriend, and we have a son who's four years old.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any one of them having any similar symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, they've been good. My wife works from home and my son, he's been his playful self.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, that's good. OK, last few questions. Do you smoke at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'll have some wine with dinner, maybe two or three nights a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Yeah, those are all the questions I had today and it seems that definitely there are some concerning symptoms like the shortness of breath and the cough especially also the loss of smell that you're having. We definitely want to make sure that you don't have coronavirus, so we will do a test for you today. And what we recommend in the meantime is to self isolate, even in your home, wear a mask around your family, if you can, like, eat separately, don't go outside and be off of work until the test results come back and then even after that, you might need to follow instructions of public health and self isolate for 14 days. If not coronavirus, hopefully, then it can also be other things, like, other viruses can cause similar symptoms as well, but yeah. So, we'll just get that test done and then see where to go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, that sounds great. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
